subject_terms_3: Artistic photography  Portrait photography  Building and Construction
materials_name: gelatin  paper (fibre product)  silver sulfide  baryta paper
object_work_type: black-and-white prints (photographs) gelatin silver prints  photographic prints
physical_appearance: This is a gelatin silver print and the image captured has a central focus on a half dressed man balancing on a composite supporting structure made of wooden rods joint together. With his arms outstretched, he is seen reaching out for the next rod with his right hand.  The person in the photograph is actually the artist himself.
sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. These photos are typical of the salon photography style of the time, with an emphasis on technique, composition and tone. The cleaner in this photo is actually the photographer himself.
techniques_name: gelatin silver process photographic printing techniques black-and-white photography
